remixlab.fpstiming

Class AnimatorObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • remixlab.fpstiming.AnimatorObject
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Animator
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractScene

    public class AnimatorObject
extends Object
implements Animator
    Class implementing the main Animator behavior.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AnimatorObject()
      Constructs an animated object with a default animationPeriod() of 40 milliseconds (25Hz).
      AnimatorObject(TimingHandler handler)
      Constructs an animated object with a default animationPeriod() of 40 milliseconds (25Hz).

    • Constructor Detail

      • AnimatorObject

        public AnimatorObject()
        Constructs an animated object with a default animationPeriod() of 40 milliseconds (25Hz). The handler should explicitly be defined afterwards ( setTimingHandler(TimingHandler)).

      • AnimatorObject

        public AnimatorObject(TimingHandler handler)
        Constructs an animated object with a default animationPeriod() of 40 milliseconds (25Hz).

      • animationStarted

        public boolean animationStarted()
        Return true when the animation loop is started.

        The timing handler will check when animationStarted() and then called the animation callback method every animationPeriod() milliseconds.

        Use startAnimation(), stopAnimation() or toggleAnimation() to change this value.

        Specified by:
        animationStarted in interface Animator
        See Also:
        startAnimation(), animate()

      • animationPeriod

        public long animationPeriod()
        The animation loop period, in milliseconds. When animationStarted(), this is the delay that takes place between two consecutive iterations of the animation loop.

        This delay defines a target frame rate that will only be achieved if your animate() methods is fast enough.

        Default value is 40 milliseconds (25 Hz).

        Note: This value is taken into account only the next time you call startAnimation(). If animationStarted(), you should stopAnimation() first. See restartAnimation() and setAnimationPeriod(long, boolean).

        Specified by:
        animationPeriod in interface Animator
        See Also:
        setAnimationPeriod(long, boolean)

      • setAnimationPeriod

        public void setAnimationPeriod(long period)
        Convenience function that simply calls period(period, true).
        Specified by:
        setAnimationPeriod in interface Animator
        See Also:
        setAnimationPeriod(long, boolean)

      • setAnimationPeriod

        public void setAnimationPeriod(long period,
                               boolean restart)
        Sets the animationPeriod(), in milliseconds. If restart is true and animationStarted() then restartAnimation() is called.
        Specified by:
        setAnimationPeriod in interface Animator
        See Also:
        startAnimation()

      • stopAnimation

        public void stopAnimation()
        Stops animation.
        Specified by:

        Specified by:
        startAnimation in interface Animator
        See Also:
        animationStarted()

      • restartAnimation

        public void restartAnimation()
        Restart the animation.

        Simply calls stopAnimation() and then startAnimation().

        Specified by:
        restartAnimation in interface Animator

      • toggleAnimation

        public void toggleAnimation()
        Calls startAnimation() or stopAnimation(), depending on animationStarted().
        Specified by:
        toggleAnimation in interface Animator
